website_summaries.verdict: This is a lightweight but stable raised seat ideal for households with both able-bodied and impaired occupants sharing bathroom facilities.
pros: Easy to remove and store between uses
Fits both round and elongated toilet bowls
Front and back cut-outs for easier post-use cleansing
cons: Center opening not ideal size for male users

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT secure to bowl in any way. Could be issue for someone with mobility or balance issues and cause fall.
customer_reviews.text: This does NOT attach to commode in any way. Just sets on top of bowl and if you have any balance issues it is not secure at all. Couldn't return it per item policy, but would highly recommend looking for a unit that has a way to tighten down and secure to bowl for safety. Could be dangerous for anyone with mobility or balance issues that may not be able to control where they sit every time to make sure they are centered and avoid any tip or wobble. I didn't feel safe when dealing with post op knee recovery.
customer_reviews.author: Jayna Cole

customer_reviews.title: Stable for all toilets and easily removed.
customer_reviews.text: this device works and fits on both my elongated and my round toilet. It is quite stable thanks to the rubber bumpers under the bottom of this device. The indentations are so much better than those without for access to the area needing attention. The height is as listed - I am showing it with the toilet support as this works very well for knee surgery. This is supposed to be attached WITH THE TOILET SEAT RAISED NOT ATTACHED TO THE SEAT!! It is also easily removed for other family members and is easily cleaned ( hard plastic).
customer_reviews.author: Greengrass

customer_reviews.title: This was a product that caused a bathroom accident
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to raise the seat of the toilet 4 inches so I could get up easier. Unfortunately, the non-slip feature did not work at all [it was very slippery] and I ended up on the bathroom floor and had to summon help {I have an injury to the groin that makes getting up very difficult.} The seat riser just slipped off way too easily. I had to throw it away and get something with real non-slip locking and some actual side handles to just help me up. Not recommended for use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pattinson

customer_reviews.title: It Moves
customer_reviews.text: I have had several replacements and surgeries that require the use of this dreaded seat. I'm young, partially OCD and hate that this thing moves around. I weigh quite a bit, still moves. My child doesn't weigh much at all; still moves. Overall it sucks and I don't understand why the handles are underneath the seat where you can rub against your toilet? PT had me using my walker to get up, unfortunately this thing would get up with me. Again, it moves. If you choose to buy, good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Book Nerd

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: I had a hip replacement and needed a raised toilet seat even though I have a comfort height toilet seat. This stays in place and is super easy to put on and take off. No screws necessary. Just lift the lid and seat and put it on. It might slide a bit because it’s not screwed down but it will not fall off and neither will you! . Fits round and oblong toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hip replacement!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hip replacement recovery! This toilet seat has an amazing design. It just sits on my oval Toto toilet, has never slipped (be careful that you don’t fall onto it) the opening is ample, it is easy to clean, very comfortable with little built in handles. For an amazing price. I have fully recovered from my hip surgery but this puppy and I are together for life! I also ordered the Tenker leg massagers (highly recommended), two grabbers, and a long handled litter scoop. Thanks Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Necessary to know how to use this portable raised seat.
customer_reviews.text: Pros Fits well our elongated toilet Very easy to install without any screws Use for the needy and remove for others Easy cleaning unlike the fitted raised seats Light weight to handle with ease Cons Use with caution for better stability as this is not screwed to the toilet bowl and always remember to get up holding the seat on both sides with hands . Trying to get up sideways could tilt the raised seat loose balance .
customer_reviews.author: Sabitha K.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased one a few days ago, the product is ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one a few days ago, the product is everything it claims to be. The sides have grab slots built in, there are front and rear cut outs for facilitating wiping, and no inside seam which makes cleaning easier. The unit is not designed to be placed over the seat it must be placed on the porcelain rim (seat up position). This makes it very stable and works on both round and oval bowls. Bought another one today with knowing that it's made in the USA! Keep those jobs in America.
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: Stable and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I recently had surgery and purchased this item based on reviews. It was extremely easy to install on my oblong toilet, very stable and comfortable. The comfort surprised me because it is hard plastic. Super easy to clean! One thing I would do differently? I would measure, measure, measure. I'm 5'5" and it was a little too tall for me, 1 or 2 inches makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Columbia Insulation LLC

customer_reviews.title: It is a Life (Knee) Saver
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered two of these raised toilet seats. They are for my wife who has osteoarthritis in both of her knees. She says it is a life (knee) saver. The one I ordered fits my toilets, and it should fit any toilet with the elongated bowl. Just raise the lid and plop it down. And, thanks to the specials rubber "grips", it stays put and doesn't slip around when you use it. Also, it is easy to remove and set aside for anyone who doesn't need it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuqeaux is an Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because during rehab it was impossible to sit normally. This just perfect and won’t slide around and it’s easy to clean. I also did not want the large hand grabs on the standard. It is very portable.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Murphey

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: Until I can afford to have one of those high, "senior citizen" toilets installed, this inexpensive device is solving my problem of not being able to get up off my low toilet. It stays put quite well, and is easy to clean. Very happy to have discovered this unique product. As others have noted, you do have to leave the seat up all the time in order to use it, which is not ideal, but acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Carol F. Goodson

customer_reviews.title: It’s a toilet seat.  It works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: All those one star reviews were written by idiots who can’t read instructions. It’s totally sturdy and very stable.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Oblivious

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to place and use
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews of several toilet seat risers in here i ordered this one, and have not been disappointed. I don't need arms on my seat as I use a cane and a Stander Security Pole to get up. The seat fits our toilet base well but is easily removed so it can be kept for personal use. An unexpected benefit was how much warmer it felt in cold weather than our regular toilet seat!
customer_reviews.author: EbenAnder

customer_reviews.title: Simple idea solving serious problem
customer_reviews.text: It takes 3 seconds to install and ends the problem of toiletd that are too low. I should hsve had it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Better than average raised toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: This hard molded plastic raised toilet seat has convenient indentations for personal wiping. The shape is relatively comfortable, plus easy to clean. There are glued on grippers on the bottom to help it stay firmly put on the toilet rim while the original toilet seat is raised. The directions say the holding weight is 275 pounds; I wish that important information had been listed by the seller in its Amazon blurb. This seems like a better than average raised toilet seat, and is helpful for those with a bum knee or recent surgery. It does not have handles. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Northern SW

customer_reviews.title: Well made and good fit
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research before making this purchase. I have a round toilet with inside opening measuring 10" x 12". the inner lip ( approx 9.5" x 11.5") fits just right. the friction pads prevent slip. Getting a new hip and I think this is exactly what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.author: HeBeGB

customer_reviews.title: I think I made a good choice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this raised toilet seat because I am going to have knee replacement surgery. I’m preparing. It fits my toilet only with the seat up, It fits easily inside of and over the rim and does not move. It does not attach to anything permanently. I like that I can take it off easily and rinse or wash it in case it gets dirty. It is extremely portable because there are no fixed attachments. Sits very high.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Mascio

customer_reviews.title: Caution, slippery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this prior to full knee replacement surgery. Even though we have ADA height toilets, I knew my range of motion post-surgery was going to be compromised. I was disappointed to find this plastic booster was too slippery to use safely, as it moved around on the rim of the toilet. I ended up abandoning it after first use. As it was a personal care product, it was not returnable. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: wamaruna

customer_reviews.title: Close, but no cigar
customer_reviews.text: Big problems with this product, if you happen to be MALE. There just isn't enough clearance in the toilet opening to jam your penis through to comfortably urinate. Probably fine for women, should be marketed them exclusively. I've struggled to use this for two weeks. Finally I ordered a different product, elongated with open front.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stample

customer_reviews.title: but have rheumatoid arthritis which affects my knees terribly. Just sitting on the toilet brought tears
customer_reviews.text: I am only 53, but have rheumatoid arthritis which affects my knees terribly. Just sitting on the toilet brought tears. I live in a small apartment and did not want some huge, cumbersome lift that I had to install. This Yunga is perfect. It sits securely, and is so lightweight that I can easily remove it and hide in the shower when company comes. I also give it a quick rinse while taking a shower several times a week. The only down side is that I can't lower the toilet seat or lid, but it's worth it to sit pain-free. NOTE: I don't actually have an elongated toilet, but this fits perfectly. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after having back surgery and I couldn't be happier with this raised seat. It does not slip or slide on my elongated bowl. I have it installed with the main toilet seat in the upright position. It is easy to place and easy to remove. Simply place it on the toilet bowl. My husband takes it off when he uses the toilet, he finds it more comfortable without it. He puts it right back on after he's done. My only problem is short legs so I slide the bathroom scale under my feet for support. The value for the price you pay is excellent! Shipping was super fast. I give this an A+ rating!
customer_reviews.author: SisuGal

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: Moved too much. No way to secure. A true safety hazard for an elder person getting on and off. Bad.
customer_reviews.author: Lindalu

customer_reviews.title: best thing ever for people with hip issues
customer_reviews.text: Very well wrapped and packaged. Although there are no instructions it's pretty easy to figure out that you lift the toilet seat and set it down on the porcelain rim. The silicone pads are big and thoroughly prevent any slipping or moving. The little built in handles make it easy to hold on to get up. This is just what i needed due to limited mobility with bad hip issues. It puts your toilet seat at a much more attainable height when standing up and lowering yourself is difficult. It is easily removable and fits nicely between the toilet and the vanity when others need to use the facilities.
customer_reviews.author: LizP

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfect, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: For people with poor backs and hip problems, like me, this is the perfect solution for the obvious dilemma.
customer_reviews.author: Irving Hackett III

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality, just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: Since this raised toilet seat is in anticipation of a hip surgery, am surprised at its excellent quality & strength for the low price. It surely could be used on a fulltime basis for an elderly patient. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kris (.

customer_reviews.title: This is a standard-sized riser
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace a standard size toilet elevation device that doesn't fit properly on an elongated toilet. It's exactly the same size as the standard item we intended to replace. Unable to return even while it's still in the sealed packaging. This is the most disappointing purchase I've ever made on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Still young, but wiser

customer_reviews.title: Perfect raised seat for elongated toilet.
customer_reviews.text: I am 65. I have arthritis. Hips, knees. This raised seat which fits my elongated toilet perfectly is exactly what I needed to ease the pain of sitting so low and trying to get up off the toilet. Since this makes the toilet higher, I do have a small short stool in front of the toilet to set my feet on (raises body to ideal position for elimination) This is comfort plus! I wish I had done this sooner. It does not slide as it has 4 pads underneath and seems to sit inside the rim somewhat. I am not afraid I will fall off. cleans easily. This will not fit a round toilet seat.
customer_reviews.author: AZMOM

customer_reviews.title: need to do better with making shore it fits and stays installed on toilet
customer_reviews.text: it just sits on my toilel when i get up it moves no stability at all waist of money the other toilet seats did not move wont be buying this again
customer_reviews.author: Wicked R

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for me!!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a life saver for me! Both of my knees are bone on bone. It had become almost impossible and very painful using the restroom. We just moved to a new house with a very small toilet. I ordered this product and it has exceeded my expectations. I have had no problems with it slipping. Also very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: This raised seat worked great. Does not move on the toilet so no ...
customer_reviews.text: I had knee surgery in another city and rented a house to recoup. I know from renting other houses that most of the toilets are the old low ones. This raised seat worked great. Does not move on the toilet so no worry when your on one leg. Very easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I decided that this was the best for me
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to get this brand, since I had never heard of it before. After looking over many others online, I decided that this was the best for me. I like the slightly taller height, and the front and back being more open. After using this for a couple weeks, I love it and am certain I bought the best one. It is so very comfortable. Sometimes it shifts a little, but nothing big, and it never tips. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip D.

customer_reviews.title: A definite for those with knee problems!
customer_reviews.text: I have a comfort height elongated Toto Drake bowl. While this did not fit on the seat, if you lift the seat and put it on the bowl rim, it fits great. The non skid pads keep it from sliding around. Very comfortable, and wonderful since I had injured my knee. it also fits securely on my older, standard round bowl, again, on the rim. The front and rear indentations make things easy, and the indented handles at the sides make it easy to remove as needed. Very lightweight, but very solid, structurally. Will hold someone who is quite overweight. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn DumondTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item based on a lengthy and detailed review by another person. Her review answered all my questions. I have a painful knee and this seat allows me to get on and off the toilet with ease. No more launching myself up to get off the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: It is a good booster, I read the reviews before ordering it
customer_reviews.text: It is a good booster, I read the reviews before ordering it. It also had an "Amazon Choice". So I decided it will serve a useful purpose. It sits well over my toilet. Thanks for one of the reviews that said it gets soiled. After the first time I used it I checked it, sure enough - so I rinse it with soap and water every morning and air dry. It is comfortable and helpful
customer_reviews.author: GY

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for a small to medium size person.
customer_reviews.text: Needed this after hip replacement surgery. Served its purpose. Solidly built. Stayed secure on the toilet w/o and wobble or shifting. It held my weight easily (6'8" 340 lbs) but the opening is very small making use of this by a large person very difficult. The best day of my recovery was when I no longer needed this! Would do well for a small to average size person.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: this raised toilet seat is wonderful. After injuring my knee and being on crutches
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this raised toilet seat is wonderful. After injuring my knee and being on crutches, I find it very difficult to lower and lift myself with one leg. This raised seat makes it so much easier. It is very secure and does not slip nor slide on the toilet. It has a nice satin finish that keeps it from feeling so cold like hard plastic toilet seats. Not a big problem in San Diego, but it's a nice bonus. It fits all of my toilets, both regular and elongated bowls, is easy to set in place and easy to remove. I
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Whatever your reason, this works.
customer_reviews.text: Who wants to rate a toilet seat? It's certainly one of those items that either works, or it doesn't. This was bought for my elderly mother so she would feel comfortable while traveling. She really needed the extra height because of arthritis in her knees and hips. She would hesitate to visit relatives homes for obvious reasons and life is just too short to miss out for something like this. We found it can be thrown in an extra pillow case and discreetly carried.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.... Thank God...... Great find.
customer_reviews.text: This is a lifesaver. Omg. I've been in such pain, pulling myself up. This has really helped my shoulders. If it's not sealed down to toilet Be careful...it can come off while you're leaning over.
customer_reviews.author: Jill E Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Great product for toilet assistance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an elderly family member as they are getting to a point where they need assistance. For the price, you can beat the Yunga Raised Toilet Seat. It fits pretty much any toilet you will encounter, in my case a standard toilet, and it doesn't slide off. It is a snap to clean as it does not have any crevices or malformed seams to collect bacteria, debris, etc. It is contoured to fit men and women and has been used extensively with a 220 lb male. Works great and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: J Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one of these!  excellent toilet seat riser!
customer_reviews.text: fits very securely on the toilet rim(not seat..must be placed on toilet rim) for round toilet... very solid and secure feel... and, great design in front and back with open areas for clearance matters. very comfortable and easy to clean. have not had a single issue with two(2) of them.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & dekeTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I was preparing for ankle surgery and needed to be able to step down onto my good leg and not push myself up which can be ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits my toilet perfectly with the seat up. The rubbery pads on the bottom help it stay in place and I feel perfectly safe when using it. There is more room for personal hygiene than in others I've owned. I was preparing for ankle surgery and needed to be able to step down onto my good leg and not push myself up which can be painful and not a good idea for someone with replaced knees. I had the surgery last week and am very happy to have this toilet seat. It's working well for me and saving my knees! The ankle? - well we'll have to see how it goes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: ... did not reach the floor and would not be good for cleanliness after eliminating
customer_reviews.text: Too high for someone shorter than 5'2"--feet did not reach the floor and would not be good for cleanliness after eliminating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, good design
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased for hip replacement recovery as recommended by my medical team. I read many reviews and chose this model because it has the indented areas front and back allowing room to move. Others were a solid circle. It's well made and doesn't slide or move around in "boarding" or use. The bottom has several flat, thin rubber pieces enabling it to remain secure and unmovable to the toilet seat rim. Wipes clean easily and moving from one toilet used in the day to upstairs at night requires just picking it up. Highly recommend as it's turned out to be an important pain saving part of my recovery.
customer_reviews.author: MeHere

customer_reviews.title: came quickly, durable, fits on top seat or ...
customer_reviews.text: came quickly, durable, fits on top seat or without seat- is stable. My mother is large, and this is perfectly find for her- she is grateful that there is an opening in the front of toilet. Height is perfect- 5 inches, but if you took off seat it is lower. Her seat is a round and toilet is rather low to ground. She thinks it would work in elongated toilet too. No more ambulances needed to help her off toilet! :)
customer_reviews.author: kirsten

customer_reviews.title: ... mother had bought one of these and was so pleased that, after I tried it at her home
customer_reviews.text: My mother had bought one of these and was so pleased that, after I tried it at her home, I had to have one, too. I'm tall plus I have arthritic knees. How wonderful to be comfortable and to get up and down without pain while using the toilet! Cleans so easily, too. Made in the USA is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Joan L. Redd

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for someone with knee problems
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat has been a blessing. Any person who has bad knees should have one if these. This seat fit my elongated toilet perfectly. I did not have to use the sticky tabs. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great! No installing
customer_reviews.text: Works great! No installing, just raise the seat on your toilet, lay this one on, and you're good to go! Doesn't slip around and the height is exactly what I needed to make it easier to sit down and get back up, without having to hold onto anything to help me up. Only one problem -- there is a "backsplash" that soils the inside so that you do need to rinse it off (or wash if needed) and dry it occasionally. I didn't even know it was soiled until I lifted it off to move it, and looked underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This raised seat arrived on time. It's a no brainer to put on and take off. No fasteners or anything to attach to the toilet. Simply raise the toilet seat and put it on ~ it's that easy. It has 4 non slip pads beneath the seat which seem sturdy enough to prevent slipping. The added height is working out great on my knees. Very happy with this seat.
customer_reviews.author: Gnome_de_plume

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution for needing a raised toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my needs after surgery- easy for other members of family to remove , just pick it up and set it to the side- easy to clean . For our round shaped toilet I found it better to set directly on toilet versus on toilet seat. The only con is that if there is moisture between raised toilet seat and toilet it could slide around. After realizing this I just made sure to sit directly on the raised seat versus sliding onto it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Causey

customer_reviews.title: Secure fit
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to spend the money to buy this because I was having hip replacement in a couple of weeks, but it is the best thing I could have done for myself. It fits exactly the way the it should on the toilet, and I feel secure using it. It is a little higher than I expected it to be. but it is helping me now, and it will be very helpful after my surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Rosemary

customer_reviews.title: Toilet riser
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use after my hip replacement. I was a bit skeptical after reading some reviews of instability but the price was right and I thought I would try it. I have an elongated toilet and this fits firmly on the toilet bowl. You do not want to put it on the toilet set or it will be unstable. Designed for both round or elongated toilet bowls it is working well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Gerhardstein

customer_reviews.title: Good for smaller person with good arm strength.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for hip surgery. Wasn't sure it would stay in position with just friction pads on the bottom, but so far, no issues. I am 5'4" and 125 lbs. If you are larger and not strong enough to lift up on your own, you'd probably be better off getting a stationary seat with handles.
customer_reviews.author: NFLP

customer_reviews.title: Convenience without undue pain
customer_reviews.text: It raised a standard toilet seat to where it was easier to get on & off after knee surgery. It was almost too tall!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice price and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: nice price and easy to use .because of the arrangement of fixtures in the apartment and the fact the place is rented this raised seats is ideal. no extra room available for handgrips and i dont have to wait for maintainance to install .since is likely to be temporary the reversal will be easy.also is stable when used.
customer_reviews.author: j beval

customer_reviews.title: DOES THE JOB.  Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and it does what they say it will do. Am having knee surgery soon, but tested it prior to surgery. My only problem with it, the seat is hard and the plastic is cold. Can be a shock in middle of night. Don't know if they make these with soft seats. Other than that, I am very pleased with it and am sure it will come in really handy after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: This toilet seat is great. Quality made and will last for a long time. Bought it for my Aunt when she comes to visit. She needs the extra rise to get up easily and she has no problem getting off this seat compared to a standard size toilet. I lifted up the lid and seat and put it on the bowl, it fits perfectly and snuggly. I recommend this product to all that are looking for this type of seat.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: With a recent hip replacement, I needed to use raised toilet seat...this one is slip-resistant, comfy, works well with lower front/back areas for wiping, and comes at a price that is less than renting a lesser version for a month from the medical supply store. If there's a disability or a person otherwise needing a raised toilet seat, this one is super. It's easy to remove, light weight, and cleans very easily. I even ordered a second one for a second toilet in my house.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very Unstable and Small Opening
customer_reviews.text: Was not stable. If you put pressure on the front it would nearly flip forward. Not good for a person with limited mobility. Also inside opening not very large. Not nearly as large as an elongated toilet bowl. Could not return. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Would Be Five Stars If It Weren't Too High
customer_reviews.text: The product fits nicely and easily on our elongated toilet, and generally stays in place. The only problem is that it is way too high for my mother, who is under five feet tall. I will have to find a lower one, as this one is hard for her to use and actually presents a danger of her falling off due to dementia issues.
customer_reviews.author: S. Goulding

customer_reviews.title: FALSE ADVERTISING
customer_reviews.text: Not true...advertises that it fits both elongated & round, FA L S E. I have a round seat and when you sit, it pops up in the back. Unlike Easy Comforts toilet seat which I had previously purchase for the upstairs toilet...it fits snuggly. I know now to buy the type that ONLY fits your bowl. Very DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: B. Berrocal.  B2B

customer_reviews.title: Opening too small
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately there are two issues with this seat: 1. the opening is much smaller than that of a regular toilet seat, and 2. it is made of a very hard plastic that might be a problem for anyone with hip pain issues.
customer_reviews.author: reviewerb

customer_reviews.title: Just got this and love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and love it!! So easy to put on, just raise the lid and seat and set it straight on the toilet bowl!! I'm a very large woman and this seat could have been custom made for me!!! The cut out areas in the front and back make it so much easier to clean after using the bathroom!!! This raiser replaced my old one I've used for over 6 yrs and sure do wish I had this one from the get go!!!
customer_reviews.author: ladygardener

customer_reviews.title: I bought this because it was oblong and should fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was oblong and should fit my toilet. Well it did not fit the inside was to small so the toilet seat would move all over. I tried to send it back but they said I could not. So now I still don't have one that fits right and I have a new one that I can't use.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Good seat
customer_reviews.text: Looks better than the old one we had. Elderly father fits better on this one as opposed to ones with handles. Hasn't slipped from seat and I like the fact it can easily be removed to clean or when guests come over.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: This seat is fantastic. It is light weight and stays in place and is comfortable. I highly recommend it for anyone who has sore or weak knees. I have had knee replacement and it is wonderful. Besides it doesn't look so bulky and bizarre as some of the seats with handles. It is way better than the one I bought for $40 at the hospital store.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J.

customer_reviews.title: Useful post-spinal surgery.
customer_reviews.text: I had spinal surgery and this raised seat made toilet use tons easier. It fit the elongated seat cover well and was very stable. My brother advised me to keep it, because he said that it would be helpful for post-knee surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: I like that there are no clamps and it stays secure ...
customer_reviews.text: This one works really well. I like that there are no clamps and it stays secure on the toilet bowl, due to the pads on the underside. Just remember you must flip up the entire toilet seat first.
customer_reviews.author: KT

customer_reviews.title: Decent but could use improvement.
customer_reviews.text: It does it's job but could be better. It doesn't slide around much on my elongated toilet, but the front cut out is far too small to fit my hand in, and the rear one is no better. I had foot surgery and needed a higher seat to keep my balance and to reduce strain on my legs. It is easy to clean and seems to resist any staining; it is also lightweight to carry for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Dervin

customer_reviews.title: Toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: This was very good easy to clean and very sturdy and perfect size
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price, works fine
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband who just had a knee replacement and had a little trouble getting all the way down. This has worked out just fine and I would recommend this to anybody for a temporary situation.
customer_reviews.author: P. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. After ordering I realized I should have got one with handrails. However I am not sure one with handrails would have fit in the space I have. The wall and doorway are close enough that I managed without the rails. I recently had back surgery and one of these seats is a must. I am 5'3" and the height worked out great for me. One inch shorter would have been okay but I wouldn't have wanted it any taller. Great value and met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: G. Sexton

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: First time having to use a toilet seat riser. This one fits perfect on my toilet. My knee does not hurt. Easy to clean when necessary. Easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: New York Rose

customer_reviews.title: SEAT IS GARBAGE.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS ONE PIECE OF GARBAGE. I NEEDED AN ELONGATED RAISED SEAT. THIS ONE IS NOT FOR A MALE AS HIS PARTS CANNOT CLEAR THE FRONT OF THE SEAT. IF YOU WANT TO PEE ON THE FLOOR OR WALL THIS IS IDEAL. IT FITS ON AN ELONGATED TOILET AND SHORT CHANGES YOU. IT HAS LESS SPACE THAN A NORMAL ROUND SEAT. I NEEDED THIS FOR MY FORTH COMING HIP REPLACEMENT.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT HOCHSTAEDT

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered a different seat riser that was well-reviewed, however, the hardware wasn't long enough to fit through the toilet seat and the riser. Hoping to avoid the same issue, I decided to try this model. It works wonderfully well post hip replacement surgery. And, it allows taking care of personal hygiene to be possible. This item plus the Bottom Buddy product were essential tools during my rehab. .
customer_reviews.author: J. Marler

customer_reviews.title: This seat is 2 inches to high!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this seat would be great by the reviews. Here's the skinny- It is too high! On a shorter toilet and the newer ones. I have one of each. Your feet do NOT touch the floor. For someone ill and shaky on their feet this is not good. Better have long legs. So I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ness

customer_reviews.title: Instant change to a bowl five inches taller!
customer_reviews.text: All of my bathrooms have very low toilets so I ordered one "Yunga Tart" to try it on an elongated bowl. It moved a lot until I read somebody's review and I placed it directly on the porcelain. It doesn't move anymore and it made that toilet bowl five inches taller. I'll try it on the other two toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Gables

customer_reviews.title: Not What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a soft toilet seat not this hard onej.
customer_reviews.author: connie

customer_reviews.title: This is a TERRIBLE DESIGN. I would send it back if it ...
customer_reviews.text: my husband is not a big man and is in assisted living and the seat has a recess on the front that SHOULD rise UP but instead makes a trough for his urine to flow out onto his clothing and the floor. This is a TERRIBLE DESIGN. I would send it back if it were not used already. Cannot afford this type of poor product design.
customer_reviews.author: Ned

customer_reviews.title: FITS MY AMERICAN STANDARD ROUND TOILET
customer_reviews.text: Bought this right before my hip replacement and what a god send! The height is tall enough so I can sit on in without pain and the seat doesn't move. I have an old American Standard round toilet and it fits nice and snug and stays in place! Price was very reasonable!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Don't put it on the toilet seat!
customer_reviews.text: It's stable on the toilet bowl but unstable on the toilet seat. It's a good height for me and my old knees - I'm 5 ft 6 inches, and my feet aren't flat on the floor when I'm sitting on it. 'Nice to be able to get on and off the seat easily!
customer_reviews.author: HGH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toilet seat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend with back problems because her toilet was too low and it was painful to stand up from it. She loves it and finds it to be very helpful. Good value, too..
customer_reviews.author: Miami Liana

customer_reviews.title: Items are not efficient
customer_reviews.text: These items are not efficient. The hole in the middle of the toilet seat is too small and the seat is not stable when placed on the toilet. I would like to return both items but the message from Amazon says they are not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Dot Blum

customer_reviews.title: Completely unstable and terrifying.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't love have 100% accurately when sitting down, the seat will take you for a ride. It's terrified me a couple times after having hip surgery. Don't risk it. If you need a raised toilet seat it's worth spending a bit more to get something solid.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Nice design raised toilet seat
customer_reviews.text: Nice contoured design. Fits my elongated bowl but also will fit round bowl. Lip on bottom of raised seat and pads make the seat fairly stable without the use of a clamping device. I'm 6'-2" and set seams plenty strong. Toilet seat flips up to allow this raised seat to be taken on and off toilet easily.
customer_reviews.author: Ted H

customer_reviews.title: It just looked like it wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the package, I thought the riser would be much too high (of course, it is the 4" as advertised). It just looked like it wouldn't work, and I figured I'd have to send it back. It Is Perfect. I just lifted up the toilet seat, place the raised seat down.....and it is just what I needed. Recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: silkie

customer_reviews.title: Think ahead...no pun intended
customer_reviews.text: It feels insecure with only the four friction pads to keep it from sliding. However, i have not had an actual problem. It is also about 1/2 inch higher than would have been optimal for me. I did not measure when I purchased, so that's my own fault.
customer_reviews.author: Special mom

customer_reviews.title: Could not get off a standard toilet do to bad knees this makes it easier and sure beats spending ...
customer_reviews.text: Could not get off a standard toilet do to bad knees this makes it easier and sure beats spending 250.00 on a new tliet
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Sliwinski

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The product had good review and was made in the USA. I had knee surgery and needed something to assist me. The only complaint is that it should have a wider opening; don't think there is reason to discuss why. Cleans up easy and comfortable to sit on.
customer_reviews.author: Sharen

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me even though thank God I only needed ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for me even though thank God I only needed it for a few days after my surgery. I have an elongated toilet so it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Greenapples

customer_reviews.title: This seat works great! I'm sorry I waited so long to purchase ...
customer_reviews.text: This seat works great! I'm sorry I waited so long to purchase it. It has certainly made a huge difference (for the good) for me in the bath room. Plus, it's so easy to install and wash. Nice, simple and uncomplicated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 89 year old mother. It worked perfectly. It did not slide or move once in place. My mother was very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.author: tejanoish

customer_reviews.title: The extra 5 inch height is super.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely great--even on an already elevated toilet. My husband is very weak, and this helps him tremendously. It stays in place without any bolts, as it had non skid treatment on the underside. We'll be able to "take it with us" wherever we go to visit. The extra 5 inch height is super.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Honeycutt

customer_reviews.title: It is easy to clean and the best thing is that when ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for raised toilet seats for some time. Many were quite expensive, institutional looking and needed clamps or screws which I did not want. There were no instructions, but you just put the seat on the toilet. It has skid so it does not slip. It is easy to clean and the best thing is that when I have guests, I just remove it from the seat and place it between the vanity and the toilet. Price was very reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Janette

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money for handicapped people
customer_reviews.text: This raised toilet seat was way too high for my husband. It is NOT mentioned anywhere on Amazon (or by Yunga Tart) that it is UNRETURNABLE> nor was I given the option of choosing a less elevated seat. Bummer! Wasted money for handicapped people.
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made. It met my expectations and solved the problem of raising the seating in a very practical way. It's easy to remove, very hygienic and stable.
customer_reviews.author: M. L.  Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, especially after back surgery!
customer_reviews.text: Love this after having back surgery! Easy to get on & off the toilet with the added height. A must for all with bad backs!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy D

customer_reviews.title: Great product and so easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great product and so easy to install. Works so well for my 95 year-old aunt that she wanted a second one which she installed herself. There's nothing to unscrew because she just lifts it off for cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: jjbk

customer_reviews.title: Very Beneficial Product...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I have used others that required attachments that screwed on to the bowl. This one just sits with Velcro that stays secure. Easy removal for cleaning and adjustment. I like this product.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Toilet seat riser.
customer_reviews.text: Not much room to wipe yourself. Other than that, really helped me to stand up. The lift was great for my hip!
customer_reviews.author: B. St Louis

product_meta.title: Yunga Tart Raised Toilet Seat
product_meta.description: Easy to install, sits directly on toilet rim with the seat lid cover and seat raised into upright postion. Durable, lightweight and comfortable. Elevates the seat height 4-3/4". Four non-skid pads on bottom to keep in place. Easy to clean and transport. Perfect for home surgical recovery after a hip replacement or knee surgery. Holds up to 275 pounds. Dimensions Inside hole 9 5/8 x 7 ½ Ring 11 3/8 front to back, 9 3/8 wide Overall 15 7/8 wide, 16 7/8 front to back Goes hand in hand with Yunga Tart Reacher Grabber “Plucker’Up” reaching aid.
feature_bullets: Raises toilet seat height 4-3/4", sits directly on toilet with the seat raised
Portable, Fits Round, Elongated and Compact Elongated Toilets
Holds up to 275 pounds, Seamless edges, easy to clean, Made in the USA
Front and back recess for easy reach in, Four non-skid pads on bottom, Contoured with a wider surface for more comfort and stability
Due to sanitary reasons, this product may not qualify for a return due to Amazon's return policies

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
